Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the image shows a shrine to Prophet Mohammad in a forest mountain cave, when in reality it is the entrance to Tianmen cave in China.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the image by presenting it as a shrine to Prophet Mohammad, when it is actually a popular tourist spot in China.
Understate: There is no understatement bias present in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misrepresenting the location and purpose of the image.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide substantial evidence to prove the existence of a shrine to Prophet Mohammad in the image.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the image depicts a shrine to Prophet Mohammad without proper verification.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the image, such as it being a popular tourist spot or the presence of other religious statues in the same location.
